page.title: 03The Life of a Village Bobby
page.content: My day commences at New Mills Police Station. Check the Diary, noting file and my own personal work folder. Has anything happened on my area during days off? At this point it's off to Chinley on my motorcycle via Furness Vale and Buxworth. Check en route anything out of the ordinary-abandoned vehicles, road works and defects, road signs requiring attention. On arrival at Chinley, I park my motor cycle at a friendly resident's house, have a short chat and a coffee with him before commencing patrol on foot. Once onto the main road I stop to speak to local residents, listen to comlaints, give advice. It doesn't take long to note any praise thrust upon us. A meal comes, if possible, between the 3rd and 5th hours, after which I move on to another village. { by P C John Draycott
